Vote.definition: a usually formal expression of opinion or will in response to a proposed decision ;esp

1 a.definition: to cast or conduct a vote [ for acquittal]

sub_terms.b: to exercise a political franchise [encourage people to ]

2.definition: to cast votes on a corporate matter on the basis of [their shares against the proposed merger]
2.voted: their shares against the proposed merger]

3.definition: the right to cast a votethe right of suffrage

4 a.definition: the act or process of voting [brought the question to a ]

1.definition: to choose, endorse, decide the disposition of, defeat, or authorize by vote [ an appropriation]
